website_summaries.verdict: This set of bindings is easy to mount to your snowboard — a great choice for beginners who don’t want to tweak the hardware much.
pros: Features a rear-entry design in the bindings, so it’s easy to put on and take off
Includes plenty of padding in the ankle strap, the highback, and the footbed for a comfortable fit
cons: Experienced snowboarders will want to look elsewhere
Sometimes, it’s tough to make these bindings tight enough

customer_reviews.title: Great bindings, love them, but fix the lean adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: After careful consideration I wound up deciding on these. I absolutely love them, and for the money I think they're unbeatable. They only took me about 5 minutes to get used to, and after that (like some other reviewers) I spent of my time at the top of the hill waiting for others in my group to strap up! Seriously cut the amount of time spent strapping in by a whole lot. My only gripe really is that the forward cant adjustment knob moves on its own, and especially so every time you un-strap that foot. so every few runs I had to readjust them. I'll get that taken care of using some loctite or something though.
customer_reviews.author: Jester_84-07

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice. You won’t be disappointed with these bindings.
customer_reviews.text: These bindings exceeded my expectations. No more sitting in the snow to strap in. I am suprized how easy these are to get in and out of. They provide really good control with the board. I have a size 11 boot and got the XL. Wise choice since I think the L would have been difficult to get in. My only complaint is that the description says the plate provided fits 3 hole burton boards, but it did not fit MY 3 hole Burton Canyon board. Luckily I had my old plate and it fit perfect. Maybe burton has changed hole locations and mine is different.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Easy in, good control
customer_reviews.text: I've ridden Flow bindings for several years, and thought I'd give these a try on my second snowboard. The toe-cap design gives me good control on heelside turns. They're easy to get in, and almost as easy to get out. If you don't like sitting on the snow and ratcheting your binding straps, give these a try.
customer_reviews.author: D. Craig Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Rear entry bindings are so much better than regular
customer_reviews.text: Rear entry bindings are so much better than regular. These are stuff enough as well. It takes ten seconds to lock yourself in and being able to lock and loosen the over the foot strap is very important. The only draw back with this binding is the back support had to be sanded down. This is my family's second pair of these bindings and both had to be sanded so the boot could be pulled out. If you don't, it can top the sole of of your boot
customer_reviews.author: Chika

customer_reviews.title: Love the rear entry, but...
customer_reviews.text: First time using rear entry and love it. That is why I will five it two stars instead of one. they broke the first day. The pin holding the locking strap came out. Luckily it was after my last run and i was able to find all the parts and put it back together with a bolt from the hardware store for the second day. (Note, as someone else mentioned, the adapter does not fit burton three hole pattern. had to modify it some.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bindings.  No GREAT Bindings!
customer_reviews.text: I am a adult snowboarder with orthotics and other foot problems . I normally use old school straps. I don't know if these were any faster to get into than straps, but they are sure comfortable! The toe clip was fantastic, and the even pressure was awesome. My feet usually get sore/numb after a while from the pressure points on straps, Not with these! Not super stiff, but acceptable medium. I used them on my wide carving board (Boardercross) for 3 days and they held their own! Price vs Quality is top notch! I will probably buy another pair for my second board.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: easier to strap up
customer_reviews.text: product seems to be of good quality, I didn't see any red flags of cheap components. I used the bindings 4 full days at copper CO. They kept coming loose where bindings screw to board but i'm pretty sure thats a problem with my board and me since other bindings did the same thing. easy to strap up without sitting down, sometimes I could lock in without stopping sfter leaving lift.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good design, max size 12 fo XLs
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous at first, could barely fit my size 12 boot in a XL size binding. You kinda have to pull the back up as you press your foot in, there is small friction. I attempted to adjust then but they were already fully extended. After learning to pull and press I could strap both feet in while standing in 30 seconds. Works well, but if you have larger the size 12 boots I wouldn't get these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: Love them ...where were these in the 90's?
customer_reviews.text: These work amazing. Friend bought K2 and they did not work as good as these. He returned them and got Flow bindings. I was 3 times faster at getting my foot in a ready to go..Nuff Said
customer_reviews.author: Hammer4

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I've mostly been able to say goodbye to wasting time sitting down and buckling in. On most chair lifts I have been able to strap in before reaching the top and can get off the chair and go!!!
customer_reviews.author: speakinspell

customer_reviews.title: Great but needed Burton 3D disc
customer_reviews.text: Great bindings. Contrary to Answers above these binding discs did not fit Burton 3D binding holes. I tried for over an hour to line up to no avail. Had to buy 3D discs from Burton. Deduct 1 Star. Otherwise very easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but i wondered why i don't see more ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest binding to get in and out of. Great idea but i wondered why i don't see more boarders use bindings with the same design. Now i know why, at least with these bindings. Boots always gets stuck and caught in the heal.
customer_reviews.author: sammason

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fast in fast out.  fit snug to your liking.
customer_reviews.text: Freaking love these. I get off the lift I don't have to sit down and strap up. Its slide in foot, pull up the back and clip in and then clip the preset middle strap across your foot and boom your off. takes less than 8 seconds to do. so at home set your straps on your toes and middle so when your on the mountain its clip clip off you go. Wish this design came out years ago. Worth a shot to try you wont regret.
customer_reviews.author: Kris W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've only used them once, but love them so far. They seem sturdy and well built, and make getting your boot in and out so much easier. I love that you don't have to adjust straps and buckles after every run. Great choice for the price
customer_reviews.author: jjk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been able to try them yet but they were very easy to install. All you need is Phillips head screwdriver. The binding holes matched up perfect with my board - it takes 4 screws. The easy in easy out system works great. Haven't had any issues from install. Hopefully they work flawless like expected when on the mountain!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: WOW: What took so long to invent these? Thank You
customer_reviews.text: Great Product on two trips, so far. Has saved me A LOT of time when it comes to finishing and starting my runs. Definitely worth the investment and price point. Note for Size XL: I have a size 12.5 Boot. Had to make some adjustments, in all areas, to make sure my boot fitted correctly.
customer_reviews.author: iPrime

customer_reviews.title: These are a game changer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute game changer! I was considering switching to skis because of the time I wasted getting on and off the chairlifts strapping up my old bindings... Well not anymore! These are so easy to use I can get on and off the chairlifts now without any hesitation. I can keep up with my son who skis and I didn’t have to give up snowboarding to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Heard

customer_reviews.title: Included Baseplate won't fit
customer_reviews.text: As some of the other buyers already noted, the Baseplate does not fit older Burton 3-hole boards. I contacted the seller and they said you just have to fit it in with a loose screw, but that didn't work. Luckily, I just used an old Baseplate I had and it fit fine. I will change my review if the company adds a disclaimer to the product listing that this is not compatible with older Burton 3-hole models or send me a compatible Baseplate.
customer_reviews.author: E. Raposo

customer_reviews.title: Good for my girl!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my lady! She loves these and is not to hard on the gear as I am. Easy to install and has all the items needed with good instructions!
customer_reviews.author: ECG

customer_reviews.title: These are great and a good value.
customer_reviews.text: These were a great purchase. I got out on them last season and once I got used to fastening the rear entry, it was fabulous... I look forward to another winter season to use them coming up.
customer_reviews.author: firstlast

customer_reviews.title: Great bindings
customer_reviews.text: Love these bindings. Had them in my cart for months. Only used for me season so far but for the money they are exactly what I wanted and fit comfortably. Will update if anything changes
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: These are great. Bought them for my son and he loves ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Bought them for my son and he loves them. Setup was easy. Mounting took widening one of the holes to fit a burton board but no big deal. Might get a pair for myself as getting in and out is easy.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Great snowboard bindings
customer_reviews.text: They are great and easy to get in and out. However, it may be difficult to sit down on ground and try to slip your boot.
customer_reviews.author: WookieCookiess

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!!!
customer_reviews.text: These bindings are amazing! Who needs a stomp pad anymore when you can easily slide your for in on the lift? I'm a new beginner rider and these have me bucking in faster than anybody to start heading down the hill. One time adjustment and you're ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great price ... work great
customer_reviews.text: I've spent two days boarding with these bindings and really like them. Easy to adjust, easy to put on, and easy to remove my boot. I feel very secure with them and the board feels very responsive with them. I don't know why one would pay for bindings that cost two to three times more than these do
customer_reviews.author: Oldeagle

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: These bindings are super quick to get into as you get off the lift and they have excellent performance on the ride down! I would highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: My son loves these bindings. It took away the ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these bindings. It took away the extra effort of putting on bindings. Especially for a young man that has a bit of weight on him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: my skills just got better
customer_reviews.text: I love these bindings. it is totally better than my flows. i wished i bought these before my flows. no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these bindings
customer_reviews.text: These bindings are difficult to use and my grandson was nearly hurt when they came open while on a black diamond run. I had them checked out by a shop and two different users, and the consensus isn't that they are doing anything wrong they are just a bad design. I will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad closure system design, can’t get them tight enough, XL size no good for sz 13 boot
customer_reviews.text: These boots were horrible for me. I wear a size 13 boot and the straps were barely big enough. The closure system is also crap. You can barely get them tight enough for safe or fun riding.
customer_reviews.author: lucidInc

customer_reviews.title: My son is using this on his Burton board with ...
customer_reviews.text: My son is using this on his Burton board with the channel lock mounting design. So far, he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great, super easy to put your boots into.easy installation.
customer_reviews.author: heathern

customer_reviews.title: System MTN Bindings
customer_reviews.text: I love these bindings. Now that I'm getting so much better at snowboarding I'm loving them even more.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy K

customer_reviews.title: WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: These bindings are legit. Makes my riding more pleasurable (not having to sit and ratchet) i was ready to ride 4x faster than my buddies that had to ratchet on their bindings. Go for it and treat yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bindings
customer_reviews.text: I have ridden with these 5 or 6 times. Love them. They are easy to step into, and the little pressure-release catch is awesome - relax on the lift, crank down on the slope!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for quick runs
customer_reviews.text: These fit my board and attaching them was easy enough. After the first time using them on the slope it got to be pretty easy and I did make some adjustment on the hill, no tools were required.
customer_reviews.author: S.W.

customer_reviews.title: New Generation Bindings
customer_reviews.text: Massive improvement over my generation 1 bindings. Getting in and out is a breeze. Was able to install them myself with out any issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! They work great and are good quality. GREAT price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Work great. Quick and easy to use. Used mine all season with no issues whatsoever. I love them and recommend them to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the buck
customer_reviews.text: These bindings are awesome! Very comfortable once they're adjusted correctly. These make strapping in a breeze, they are much faster.
customer_reviews.author: MudBug

customer_reviews.title: Good bindings at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Work as advertised. I appreciate the spare parts included in case I do break a strap or lose a screw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick hook in for snowboarding boots
customer_reviews.text: Allows boots to be put in snowboard 3x faster than old bindings
customer_reviews.author: The Green Machine

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye old bindings!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great feel!! Only issue with rear entry bindings is that u most likely have to be on a flat surface to enter bindings but overall great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Shanell Torres

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and very useful for quick in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Khatt Inthachanda

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Ridden 4 times and work like they should. I like them much better than my alpha flow bindings.
customer_reviews.author: Brayton

customer_reviews.title: in great condition. Excited to use these
customer_reviews.text: Shipped extremely fast, in great condition. Excited to use these. Just from test fitting them at home, I can already tell they will shave off lots of time strapping up.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Look at other options
customer_reviews.text: If you know anything about snowboarding and love to do it, these are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: derick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bindings
customer_reviews.text: They work very well and make the whole process a lot better
customer_reviews.author: Tj havens

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: works great and saves lots of time off the lift!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product.. I'm very happy with this purchase Easy to strap in at the mountain
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Service
customer_reviews.text: Seller got this item to me very quickly. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Lynn Esslinger

customer_reviews.title: The buyer
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect easy to get in and out of didn’t know you could change the toe to a different place love these bindings
customer_reviews.author: Jason Belche

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Binders!!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this binders are more difficult to use that the regular ones, but after 2 runs and watching other riders taking 3x more time than me to adjust their binders before every run... I thought this binders are Awesome. I loved that I didn't have to seat at the benches to strap them in, just laid my snowboard in the floor, step in and lift the clip to strap it in and vamonos!! in less than 5 seconds I was going down again. Super easy to use, very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Rony

customer_reviews.title: Muy bueno
customer_reviews.text: Haven't yet tested them on the slopes but they feel and look good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t bought them if it wasn’t...
customer_reviews.text: Great bindings however the center coasters do not work with Burton boards because the hole alignment are not the same... i wish the Manufacturing keep it standard.. I was able to solve the problem by use my old coaster..
customer_reviews.author: MisterEd

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit old boards
customer_reviews.text: I figured it fit everything else, why not? It didn't fit. My board is too vintage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They don't look like terrible bindings
customer_reviews.text: They don't look like terrible bindings. But I got a set and a buckle wasn't functioning correctly so returned it. The one star is because I'm annoyed that I had to spend my money shipping and returning a product that I cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: boomshakaday

product_meta.title: System MTN Men's 2020 Rear Entry Step in Style Snowboard Bindings
product_meta.description: System MTN Men's Rear Entry Step-In Snowboard Bindings : System's all new MTN snowboard bindings are revolutionizing the market. Featuring their state of the art rear entry/step-in design, these bindings are easier to get in and out of than any you have used before! Say goodbye to sitting down to strap in, or messing with straps and buckles, System's MTN bindings let you set it and forget it! Just slip the hi-back down, slide your foot in and ride away! Unlike other rear entry bindings, the MTN ankle strap automatically opens to provide tons of room to fit your entire boot, and then cinches back down with one quick lever! The patented design of the rear cable locks the hi-back in place and actually tightens with pressure, making your bindings stronger and more responsive the harder you ride, all while keeping you firmly attached to your board! But the tech doesn't end with getting in and out of these, the MTN also features full EVA padding on the hi-back and high density dampening on the footbed for a plush, comfortable ride! The 3D molded ankle strap is covered in highly durable polyurethane that offers maximum comfort and instant response! Toolless forward-lean adjust, covered baseplate and sliding strap adjustments make tweaking the MTN to perfectly fit your boot and riding style a breeze! System has perfected an easy in, easy out step-in style binding that actually focuses on performance! Footbed: High Density Dampening The MTN utilizes high density dampening pads through both the heel and toe ramp of the binding. This reduces board chatter and shock from impacts while creating a smooth cushioned ride! Whether it's icy chop, big drops, or fast lines, the MTN will feel like you're riding on a cloud. Baseplate: Fully Compatible Multidisc The fully compatible multidisc base plate allows the MTN to easily mount on all boards including standard four hole, Burton three hole, and the Burton Channel EST boards!
feature_bullets: Rear Entry Step In Style Binding
The fully compatible multidisc base plate allows the MTN to easily mount on all boards including standard four hole and the Burton Channel EST boards!
Full EVA padding on the hi-back and high density dampening on the footbed
3D molded ankle strap is covered in highly durable polyurethane that offers maximum comfort and instant response!
Medium Fit 6-9, Large Fit 9-11, XL Fit 11-14
